header.title: Esoteric Extension of Tarot to Develop Supersensory Powers

central_thesis: True development of supersensory powers and spiritual fulfillment arises not from external pursuits or material accumulation, but from cultivating inner discrimination, understanding the nature of values, and aligning one's consciousness with the Higher Self, which is achieved through conscious effort and the transmigration of one's own subconscious patterns.

structure_content.chapter_title: Lesson 23: Transcriptions from Ann Davies' Class Lectures
structure_content.summary: This lesson delves into the concept of discrimination as a key to spiritual development and the cultivation of supersensory powers. It argues that focusing on external validation or material possessions leads to a distorted perception of reality and hinders inner growth. True progress is made by understanding the relative value of things, learning to trust intuition, and consciously changing one's emotional responses and behaviors to align with the Higher Self. Practical techniques, including visualizations related to Tarot Key 6 (The Lovers), are presented to facilitate this inner transformation.

key_concepts.definition: The central faculty for spiritual development, enabling one to discern true values from superficial ones. It is an intuitive faculty that involves paying acute attention to both outer and inner senses, and it is crucial for evaluating experiences and making correct spiritual interpretations. It is not a product of the subconscious alone, but a faculty that integrates all faculties.

The divine aspect of the individual, the ultimate source of security and correct interpretation. It is the director of one's life, and alignment with it is achieved by transmuting subconscious patterns and consciously directing one's emotional responses.

The part of the psyche that stores patterns and emotions, which can color all experiences. It needs to be purified and made a clear mirror for the Higher Self through conscious effort and the transmigration of its patterns. It plays a role in intuition but requires direction from the Higher Self for accurate interpretation.

The ability to assess the true worth of things, especially in relation to spiritual growth and inner fulfillment, rather than external appearances or societal norms. It is essential for avoiding entanglement in the 'whirl of opposites' and for living a rich life.

The process of changing deeply ingrained emotional or subconscious patterns by consciously acting in the opposite way. This is presented as a powerful technique for overcoming personal limitations and attracting different life experiences.

A vital faculty that is developed through discrimination and paying attention. It is the capacity to receive correct interpretations from the Higher Self, which relies on the proper input of information from all faculties.

practical_system.description: The system presented is one of inner development and spiritual purification, leading to the mastery of supersensory powers. It emphasizes the cultivation of 'discrimination' as the primary faculty. This involves paying total attention, discerning true values, and aligning one's consciousness with the Higher Self. A core technique involves consciously acting in the opposite way to one's limiting emotional patterns to transmute them. Visualization and meditative practices, particularly those referencing Tarot imagery, are employed to facilitate this process.
tools: Tarot Key 6 (The Lovers) as a symbolic framework for visualization.
The concept of the 'Angel' or 'Higher Self' as a guiding principle and ultimate authority.
The individual's own faculties (inner and outer senses, consciousness, subconsciousness) as the primary tools for transformation.
rituals: Visualization of Tarot Key 6 (The Lovers) figures (Adam/Eve as self-consciousness and subconsciousness, Angel, Sun) and their interaction, with specific spoken affirmations to clear misinterpretations and align subconsciousness with the Higher Self.
Acting out the opposite of a feared or limiting behavior (e.g., acting non-shy if shy) to transmute that pattern.
Meditative practices involving listening to the Inner Voice and paying total attention to external stimuli and internal reactions.

relevant_quotes.text: In the final analysis, what does a lifetime really matter? Whether you are a doctor or a lawyer or a housekeeper, what does it really matter in the long run? The life between incarnations is a bare split second to the Higher Self. It is discrimination in values that determines the success, the fullness of life.
Discrimination as to values is at the heart of being able to live a rich life.
No one, therefore, really enjoys good things until he is free of his dependency upon them.
Discrimination is really an intuitive faculty, a vital one, which involves all of the other faculties, both the inner and the outer senses. It depends on the ability to pay attention.
As you act so you finally become.
You do not judge; you do not condemn. Anything that you condemn, you will become. Things will push you into a situation in which you will find yourself being and doing the things you condemn.
Supersensory powers are not usable without discrimination!

critical_analysis.relevance: This text is highly relevant to students of Western Esotericism, particularly those interested in the psychological and ethical dimensions of magical practice. It bridges occult theory with practical self-development, emphasizing that true power comes from inner mastery and clear discernment, rather than mere acquisition of psychic abilities or external phenomena. The focus on values and the Higher Self aligns with Hermetic and Platonic influences within esotericism.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The material is aimed at practitioners who are seeking to move beyond superficial magical attainments and develop deeper spiritual awareness and control over their inner states. It is suitable for those interested in self-transformation, the development of intuition, and the ethical application of esoteric knowledge, particularly within a framework influenced by Theosophy and modern spiritual movements that engage with occult concepts.
